fields.description: The RMWebAppFilter redirects http requests from the standby to the active. However it drops all the query parameters when it does the redirect.
fields.summary: ResourceManager web redirects in HA mode drops query parameters

comments.body: Uploaded a patch with the fix.
What about 307 redirects? Even if they aren't generated in any RM REST API yet, they might ... this filter should be ready for them
[~steve_l] - sorry I didn't understand the case you mentioned. You're talking about a scenario where the active RM web services redirect you to a standby RM?

This message was automatically generated.

I was just looking at the redirect logic and noting it was looking at 302's only...if you are treating redirects specially, then 307s ought to be covered as well, as those are what PUT/POST/DELETE verbs should be issuing if they ever need to redirect
Uploaded a new patch to address the findbugs warnings.

bq. I was just looking at the redirect logic and noting it was looking at 302's only.

[~steve_l] - can you point me to where you found this logic? The logic in RMWebAppFilter.java is that if the node is a standby, it redirects all requests to the active.
ok, I'm wrong, this is a 307, not a 302 ... ignore everything I was complaining about
